name: Stanhope Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent bedrooms and suites which can be good value for money at weekends and on balance enough to justify a return visit if you want to be in that part of Brussels. The public areas are pleasant too. The big weakness lies in the service. A sub-standard buffet breakfast is often poorly stocked and staff are reluctant to meet even simple special requests.
reviews.title: Lovely Building Poorly Run
not a 5 star experience
reviews.text: On one occasion when entertaining in the courtyard bar with only two other customers present ,the barman took 2 reminders to come and take orders and a further half hour to deliver a round of drinks.

reviews.text: But the very worst aspect is 24 hour room service - don't order it if you value your health (and wallet). On one occasion we got a pizza still frozen in the middle and on another a bowl of cold thin greyish liquid that might have been vegetable soup.

If you like shopping, which I do!, the location is great for the shops. Also there is a greta Italian restaurant next door.

reviews.text: First of all, there are some very suspicious reviews for this hotel on this website. Just look at Girlie1 for example. For the amount of money this hotel charges, some faults can be found easily. There is no way that a real visitor would give 5 stars across the board.
reviews.title: Good if you do not have to pay. Poor value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for two nights on business in October ‘07. The room was nice if somewhat dated. The bed was comfortable and I have no complaints about getting good nights sleep. That’s where it ends.
reviews.title: Service, food, and accomodations...all 5.0!

reviews.text: €25 ($38) for a continental breakfast is nothing short of a rip off and the €20 ($30) daily charge for internet access in this day and age is a joke. Perhaps this hotel is geared towards business travellers who don’t care about paying for this stuff, but for people travelling on their own dime, there is better value to be found elsewhere in Brussels. Expect to pay €100 ($150) per person in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the hotel is located in the EU section of Brussels and the area is absolutely dead at night. Expect to get a taxi anywhere for restaurants or pubs. This place is not ‘an easy 5/10 min walk to the main hub of shops’ as Girlie1 (or perhaps Hotel Manaer1) suggests.
reviews.title: Loved the Stanhope

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a word, fantastic accommodations, food, & service. We came in mid-July. Upon check-in, though we had requested a room w/a garden view, that wasn’t what they had given us, but a quick fix took care of that. Our room was a suite, very nicely decorated, and the bathroom was nice, big and elegantly appointed. The bed was very comfortable, the best on our two-week trip to Europe with high quality linens. To nit-pick, the carpet was a little dirty, but that’s the only gripe with the room. Breakfast was a very elegant buffet, with smoked salmon, eggs, sausages, croissant, cereals, juices, crepes, and fresh fruit. Coffee, tea, & hot chocolate is served too. Quality is very high. There is a small workout room, but it is very good by European standards. The front desk staff were very knowledgeable and friendly, and answered any question we had. A metro / bus stop is a 2 minute walk, there is a very large park, a small park, and about 10 or so restaurants w/in 5 minutes. Call the hotel directly before you book to ask any questions. Big thumbs up!
reviews.title: Beautiful 5 Star Hotel

reviews.title: Gorgeous, if a bit 'stuffy'

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Stanhope with a friend and her two children (14 & 10). The best thing about the hotel is that the rooms are quite spacious - we booked two rooms. I will say that the rooms could use some updating. One room had beige carpeting that was very stained - looked awful. My room had peeling wall paper in the bathroom and elsewhere. Not what you expect for the price. The breakfast was wonderful (except that the coffee was always lukewarm, could never get a hot cup!). There is a lovely garden/courtyard. The staff was nice and tried to be helpful, but on a few occasions during our week stay they just were a bit incompetent - giving incorrect advice, failing to make the requested dinner reservation, etc. The hotel is quite close to the metro and there are a number of buses that are nearby also, All in all it was pleasant, but it was not really a great value by any means.
reviews.title: Spacious, but tired, rooms

reviews.text: I found a very fair rate on the hotel's website and decided to give it a try (I usually stayed at the Hotel Barsey which is has a rather trying brash decor).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Stanhope was beautiful. Peaceful and well-run by a professional unobtrusive staff. The room was exactly as pictured in the website photos. Very tasteful and high-quality decor and furnishings. Bathroom was very nice with a deep soaking tub and good bath products.
reviews.title: Twisty Turny

description: Offering a luxurious escape from your daily life, Stanhope Hotel is situated in the European Quarter, near the historical centre of Brussels and close to the famous Sablon Antique Square.This fabulous boutique hotel is a peaceful heaven in a prestigious turn-of-the-century Brussels residence. In 1991, Stanhope Hotel, located in the centre of Brussels, was inaugurated first 5-Star hotel in Belgium. From the delightful bright lounge, with its Library Bar, over the Brighton restaurant to the picturesque interior garden with ivy-clad walls, everything is breathing elegance and charm. After 12 years, an extensive renovation and enlargment of the property has been established, counting today 125 Standard or Classic and Superior rooms, Suites and Apartments, as well as extensive conference facilities.
